New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers have achieved a 9-0 start in their NBA season, a historic mark for the team.
They have also led the NBA in field goal percentage with 52.6% so far this season.
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers defeated the New Orleans Pelicans 131-122 to reach this historic mark.
Donovan Mitchell scored 29 points in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Kenny Atkinson emphasized the importance of consistency and teamwork.
The team has shown to be in both physical and mental prime, as highlighted by Atkinson.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Kenny Atkinson celebrated the achievement with a water shower in the locker room.
He acknowledged the contribution of each of his players in the team's success.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers will return home to face the Golden State Warriors, the team still holding the record for the best season start with 24 wins in 2015-16.
Donovan Mitchell praised Atkinson's leadership style, achieving synergy among the players and between them and their coach.
Others: The team's historic start has been fueled by their strong defense and efficient offense.
The Cavaliers have showcased their strength with impressive shooting accuracy.
